Ask HN: Why Do Tech's Gatekeepers Despise Salespeople?
text:
Ellison, Horowitz, PG, Nadella and countless others of import have espoused the critical role elite salespeople play in startup cultural and financial success (hustle, relentlessness, fierce advocacy of product teams, iterating user value prop, etc.) Yet hiring managers remain routinely and unapologetically bias towards salespeople. Bias increases by multiples when the record of sales achievement isn't related to a technical product.

For context, I've earned a 7 figure income for 10+ years as an individual contributor and have also recruited, hired & trained extraordinary achieving sales teams.

Please, please dear HN I implore you to counsel me on this subject. --->Does it not strain all credulity to believe that the totality of skills + IQ + EQ, etc. possessed by a high achieving sales professional are incompatible with mastery of a technical product, rapport with engineers & PM's, ability to facilitate TAM & competition due diligence, etc, etc, etc.?

As it stands presentlythe status quo is lose-lose. I lose an opportunity to join the tech pioneers building the future.....and they lose a 80-100 hours a week sales machine with instant ability to move the needle.

Ask HN: What Is a Better Digital Advertising Model?
text:
If the current ad model is so completely broken and hated, what does a new model look like?

A recent HN post [https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=32889929] indicated that the digital ad market is valued at $300 billion globally and growing rapidly.

Many people seem to dislike ads, being tracked, privacy violations, time wasted, etc. Yet the digital ad market continues to expand and both new and established companies are jumping into the mix. So, we will likely see ever more ads across all media platforms.

The TradeDesk [https://www.thetradedesk.com] projects that the global digital advertising market will be worth $1 Trillion dollars in the near future and that TV/Cable TV will be approx. 50% of that total. The same company states that “programmatic advertising” today represents 16-million Internet ads per second!

How/why is this market growing so fast? Are seller response rates increasing or decreasing? Why are sellers spending so much money to reach buyers? The answer must be that it’s working, otherwise the market would be shrinking in size. There must be millions of people globally that are clicking on these ads for this marketplace to work. So it seems, not everyone is unhappy with the system as it works today.

For the rest of us, how would a better digital ad system work?

- How to architect relevant advertising and still respect user privacy?

- What is a cost-effective way for sellers to reach buyers?

- Does advertising still work if user tracking is blocked?

- Is it possible to create an opt-in system for buyers?

- Should buyers be compensated to look at ads?

- Should buyers be compensated for their data?

If you were going to build a new system from scratch, what would it look like?

Thx.

title: Ask HN: Recommendations for ‘minimalist’ (e.g. not too ‘smart’) phones?
text:
Hello HN:

My close friend and I had a conversation today about doomscrolling, and I think it finally kicked me into gear.

I’m an iOS developer for a living, and I am just oversaturated at this point from the entire smartphone experience. I’m tired of the constant feeds and notifications, and while I am aware I can turn them off and change certain settings, I am finally ready to just keep my iPhone as a device I develop for/on, like my MacBook; and find an alternative.

I am impressed by this ‘Punkt’ phone[0, and I like that it can still be used to tether, and supports Signal, even - but for the feature set it seems kind of expensive.

Can anyone here at HN, who I’m sure has been in a similar situation - offer some advice on models to pick? I’m ideally looking for something around $300-400.

[0] https://www.amazon.ca/dp/B09NRKVYF4/ref=cm_sw_r_api_i_CW2GWFATNPKSRG54EV1F_0
